text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen thrilled to share

with you a delicious blondie recipe - I did
make a brunette version which is a brownie

not too long ago, and hey I wanted to pay
the blondes a little respect!

We're going to make some banana bread blondies
and then we're going to make a delicious brown

butter sugar frosting for the top - so good,
perfect for the weekend and perfect for Easter

if you're going to have people over for Easter
weekend, then this would be a great thing
to make for the weekend somewhere.

So let me run you through the list of ingredients,
it's really short and sweet and I'll tell
you in a minute why I love it so much.

You need brown sugar, granulated sugar, unsalted
butter at room temperature, you'll need flour,

baking powder and salt, this is one very ripe
banana that has been smashed with my fork,

an egg and vanilla extract and I will show
you the ingredients you'll need for the frosting.

I love this because very much like making
banana bread, how many times do you go and

buy a bunch of bananas at the beginning of
the week like I do for my daughter and by

the end of the week you're left with one or
two really ripe bananas and you don;t really
know what do do with them?

So you just stick the min the freezer and
I just make smoothies with them all week long

or you make banana bread, but this is a fabulous
alternative to that especially if you only

have one really ripe one laying around this
is perfect.

I've got my butter and both kinds of sugar
in here, and I'm just using my spatula to

get it going and then I'll switch to a whisk
when I add the egg and the vanilla.

I've also got my egg pre-heated to 350F, I
have an 8 by 8 inch pan lined with parchment

paper and sprayed with non-stick spray, I'm
just going to work the butter with the sugar
and then we proceed.

Now you add in a good splash of vanilla, egg,
and your mashed banana, it's really funny

because as soon as the bananas start to look
really ripe and soft, Mia is not a fan.

So, that's a perfect opportunity to make something
like banana bread blondies.

Now I'm going to just whisk this really well,
just want to make sure that the bananas and

everything are really well combined,d you
can do this in your standing mixer or with
a handheld electric whisk but you know what?

I need a little bit of an upper body workout,
so I'm just going to do it by hand.
Just for a few seconds, not that difficult.
Need a break already.
Weak!

And now I just switch to my spatula and mix
in my dry ingredients.
Really easy, right?

Now if you really want this to have the flavor
of banana bread then you can add some cinnamon

to this if you are used to adding cinnamon
to your banana bread like I am.

But I really didn't want to lose the buttery
blondie flavor, I didn't want to take it too

deep into banana bread so I'm going to keep
that out but if that's something that you

feel like you need to have a little bit of
that on there, then by all means, add like

a quarter teaspoon to a half of a teaspoon
of ground cinnamon and you'd be in business
this looks good.
Don't want to over work it.
Want to just pop this into my prepared pan.
Really thick and gorgeous.

These are going to go into the oven at 350F
for about a half an hour and let them cool

completely after that I'll show you what they
look like when they are done.

The blondies were in the oven for 30 minutes,
I've let them cool for about 45 minutes or

so and now we are going to work on the topping
which is so delicious and you're going to
love it!

So in a saucepan, you're going to add some
butter.

You're going to cook the butter until it browns,
until it becomes a beautiful amber color,

do not walk away and let the butter burn,
because once it burns, there's no coming back
from it.

You want it a really deep brown color, but
not burned so I will show you what it looks

like when it's there, the most important ingredient
here is your patience, which you know I am

not the best at but when I know that something
is going to be really delicious and worth

it, just stay here and babysit the butter
and I'll show you what it looks like when
it's there.

I hope you can see the color among the foam,
but it is perfect, don't worry about the foam

on top we are not making ghee, that's totally
fine, now you are going to add the brown sugar

and some milk and you are going to let this
cook and bubble up for a few minutes - oh

it l aready smells so good, and once it comes
to a boil and you let that cook for just a

few minutes, turn this off and let it cool
for fifteen minutes.

Then you pour the browned butter and sugar
mixture in here like so, and you're just going

to whisk this until it thickens and becomes
like a frosting and it's so good!

Forgot to grab my vanilla, you want a good
splash of that as well.
Oh and it smells so delightful.
And you can see..
Mmm!

The little brown bits of brown butter throughout
there, it is so outrageously good, you cannot

even imagine, so now you are going to just
pour this over top of the blondies and it's

going to set for a while, so you can make
this the night before if you want to or several

hours in advance, until that just thickens
and makes it easy to slice into it, and I'm

just going to set this aside and when it is
ready, I will share it with you.

Alright so my blondies have been sitting for
a few hours, the frosting has set and they

smell so incredible, I can't even tell you,
it has really all to do with that browned
butter frosting, it's so good.

You can cut them as big or as small as you
like.

I have a towel here, a wet towel just to kind
of clean up as I go I don't cut anything straight,
and you might be able to notice.
So don't pay attention to that.
I can't help it, nothing I ever cut is straight.

You should see me cut slices of bread, it
drives Joe insane, but hey, you know what,
can't be good at everything in this world.
I do my best.

Let's give this a try, I can't take it anymore
I want this piece right here.

Oh, look at the blondie which is not like
a cake, it's kind of like the texture of a
firm brownie, the frosting, a perfect bite.
It's heavenly goodness.
That is everything I want times a million.

It's like a delicious caramel banana bite
of heaven.

I don't know how else to describe it so I'll
stop there, so I don't sound ridiculous if

I keep going, go to LauraintheKitchen.com
for the written recipe, please give these

you have enjoyed spending time with me and
I will see you next time.
I'll save a bite for you.
Bye.
